The ACLU's Summer Advocacy Institute will bring together the next generation of social justice advocates.
  

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

What are you doing this summer? The ACLU's Summer Advocacy Institute isn't your ordinary summer camp. Rather it's an opportunity for students entering their junior and senior years of high school to participate in an advanced, firsthand learning experience for the next generation of social justice advocates.

Submit your application today!

Through an intensive eight-day program (July 18-25, 2018) in Washington D.C., students will learn directly from lawyers, lobbyists, community activists, and other experts working to defend the civil rights and liberties critical to a free and open society. In classroom sessions, lectures, and daily debates, students will explore the complex nature of defending and advancing civil liberties as well as examine the importance of these freedoms in our current society.

Sound like something you're interested in? Apply for financial aid!

Sincerely,

ACLU of North Dakota
